text: U.S. Route 160 (US 160) is a 1,465 mile (2,358 km) long east-west United States highway in the Midwestern and Western United States. The western endpoint of the route is at US 89, five miles (8 km) west of Tuba City, Arizona. The eastern endpoint is at US 67 and Missouri 158, southwest of Poplar Bluff, Missouri. Its route was made famous in song in 1975. This is because the road from Wolf Creek Pass to Pagosa Springs, Colorado in C.W. McCall's country music song "Wolf Creek Pass". == Related routes == * U.S. Route 60 * U.S. Route 260 * U.S. Route 360 * U.S. Route 460 ==References== ==Other websites== * Endpoints of US 160 * Kansas Highway Maps: Current , Historic , KDOT Category:U.S. Highways
title: U.S. Route 160
